brief_summary.textblock:
The epidemic data shows that prehypertension is associated with   cardiovascular disease,
      and heavy dietary salt intake could improve the developing of hypertension. We detected the
      risk factors of coronary atherosclerosis of prehypertensive patients with different levels
      of salt intake.

      The aim of this multicenter prospective, randomized controlled study is to evaluate regular
      physical exercise and salt diet effects on progression of coronary artery disease in
      patients with prehypertension.

clinical_study.brief_title: Regular Physical Exercise and Salt Diet on Coronary Artery Disease in Patients With Prehypertension(RESTRAIN Pre-HT)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        aged 45-75 Admission systolic BP between 120 and 139mmHg or diastolic BP between 80 and
        89mmHg coronary artery stenosis was 30%-70% -

        Exclusion Criteria:

        with a history of myocardial infarction, coronary revascularization, congenital heart
        disease and cerebrovascular diseases

        -

facility.name: General Hospital of Shenyang Militaly Region

clinical_study.official_title: Regular Physical Exercise and Salt Diet Effect on Progression of Coronary Disease in Patients With Prehypertension

primary_outcome.measure: fatal and nonfatal myocardial infarction, or coronary revascularization

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
